item.title: De-Stressing Booking.com
item.description: The writer shares an opinion piece on the overuse of persuasion tactics on e-commerce websites, specifically Booking.com, and introduces their Chrome Extension, "De-stresser," which removes stress-inducing messages and notifications from Booking.com, giving users a more pleasant experience.

item.title: I used Stable Diffusion & Dreambooth to create an art portrait of my dog
item.description: The article discusses using Stable Diffusion and Dreambooth AI techniques to create a high-quality painted portrait of a dog.

item.title: AT&T Wireless traffic shaping apparently making some websites unusable
item.description: AT&T's "unlimited" 100Mbit plan with 50GB for prioritized data may aggressively traffic shape, causing some websites to be unusable, while a test showed a Verizon SIM card did not have the same issue.

item.title: Future Blues – Emily's Cowboy Bebop Page (1999)
item.description: Sorry, there is no text provided for me to summarize.

item.title: Dishwasher Salmon
item.description: Dishwasher salmon is a fish dish made by wrapping pieces of salmon in at least two layers of aluminum foil and placing it in a dishwasher during the wash and dry cycle.

item.title: Pico3D: Open World 3D Game Engine for the PicoSystem (RP2040 Microcontroller)
item.description: The Pico3D game engine uses the second core of the RP2040 as a dedicated rasterizer/GPU to run a complete open world 3D game on a $1 microcontroller.

item.title: Wayback: Self-hosted archiving service integrated with Internet Archive
item.description: Wayback is a self-hosted archiving tool that aims to snapshot web pages in time capsules.

item.title: The fastest math typesetting library for the web
item.description: KaTeX is a fast math typesetting library for the web that offers print-quality layout based on Donald Knuth’s TeX, has no dependencies, and can easily be bundled with website resources for server-side rendering using Node.js.

item.title: 'Algebra for none' fails in San Francisco
item.description: San Francisco Unified school district's "Algebra for none" policy failed to improve the achievement of black and Hispanic students in advanced math, according to a study by Stanford professors, resulting in a widening achievement gap.

item.title: FSF Slams Google over Dropping JPEG-XL in Chrome
item.description: The Free Software Foundation criticizes Google's decision to drop JPEG-XL support in Chrome, highlighting the need for browser choice and free media formats.
